... of the mass-murderer's mountaintop evasion from justice and escape to Rome, all told through his personal letters with his wife. We have a little more insight into his death, too - the mystery of poisoning vs illness remains - but justice reached Otto Wachter. #amazinghistory

This is in fact 'Welcome back!' - Julie was here at our first ever festival, when Waterstones had a table rather than a tent, when the festival was put on to raise money for the pavillion roof - how times change! #amazinghistory

A warm welcome for a frosty talk! Julie Nicolson tells us about the winter of '62, and the aftershocks that echoed through time after it. Thank you to @ChurchHouseInv for their generous sponsorship. #amazinghistory #livinghistory #CVHF https://t.co/YR7rSHhEtw

France desperately wanted Guadeloupe back, however, and swapped what Voltaire called 'a few blasted acres of snow, only useful for getting hats from.' for what was then one of the most lucrative colonial possessions in the world. Little did they know! #Amazinghistory #CVHF

The amphibious assault on Quebec stunned France: a thousand miles away from the Atlantic, they had never dreamed that the Royal Navy would ever reach them. The initial siege was unsuccessful, but the mobility granted by the ships allowed the British to manoeuvre to victory. #CVHF

Eventually they capture fort Duclaine - renamed after Pitt the Elder: we now have Pittsburgh, a city that "could not embody more those industrial values of the time", the industrial values that had carved out the victories of this Seven Years War #amazinghistory

This is the first time regular soldiers have been sent to North America. Initially the French do very well. They sweep across the continent. In 1789, "the year of victories", the British counter-attack launches. #amazinghistory #CVHF

British museum, Kew Gardens - the atmosphere of scientific and industrial advancement was pervasive and provided real advantage - but it was Britain's ability to borrow money and supply troops by navy that gave them a global advantage. #amazinghistory #CVHF #livinghistory

It was a time of extraordinary innovation, too: not only was Adam Smith then influencing what was the start of capitalism, there was also the top-secret naval technology like precision clocks for navigation "effectively like having GPS" and copper-plated hulls. #amazinghistory
"And you do that, ladies and gentlemen, by borrowing a lot of money." A universal truth when it comes to war! #amazinghistory #CVHF
